intro: Weingartia neumanniana, commonly known as the Neumann’s barrel cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is a compact, globular plant with a ribbed structure that helps it store water efficiently. Its spines are typically short and white, providing protection from herbivores. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well-suited for arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
